name: Subrahmanyam Kalyanasundaram
content: Subruk's Site Search Subrahmanyam Kalyanasundaram Professor Department of Computer Science and Engineering IIT Hyderabad About Me I am a faculty member at the CSE Department, IIT Hyderabad. I am part of the Theory group. Research Interests I am interested in all aspects of Theoretical Computer Science. I have worked on Complexity Theory, Combinatorics and Graph Algorithms. Education Ph.D. in Algorithms, Combinatorics & Optimization from College of Computing, Georgia Tech (2011). I was fortunate to have Dick Lipton and Asaf Shapira as my Ph.D. advisors. M.S. in Mathematics from Georgia Tech (2009). M.E. in Telecommunication Engineering from Indian Institute of Science (2003). B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering, NIT Calicut (2001). Course Materials. Previous semesters ( full list) I usually teach courses in the area of Theoretical Computer Science. Courses that I have offered in the past fall into broadly two categories — graduate level elective courses and undergraduate level core courses such as Data Structures, Algorithms and Theory of Computation.
